content:
• Monday, April 16, 2012
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) +4.5% AH after regulators approve the company's plans to build a...

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) +4.5% AH after regulators approve the company's plans to build a $10B Louisiana natural gas export terminal. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM
  • EXR

    Extra Space Storage (NYSE:EXR) -2.3% AH after agreeing to buy out partner Prudential Real Estate...

    Extra Space Storage (NYSE:EXR) -2.3% AH after agreeing to buy out partner Prudential Real Estate Investors from its interest in 36 self-storage properties for $298M and announcing a 7M-share common stock offering to fund the acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM

  • Valero Energy gives its Q1 interim update, saying its EPS coming will be around $0.25 - $0.35,...

    Valero Energy gives its Q1 interim update, saying its EPS coming will be around $0.25 - $0.35, above Street estimates of $0.20. On an adjusted basis, the company says its decision to temporarily shut down an Aruba refinery will push it into the red for the quarter. The refinery was shut down last month due to inadequate margins as the industry struggles with major shifts in fuel demand and production. Shares +1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD) -3.4% AH after announcing chairman Kaleil Isaza Tuzman has resigned....

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD) -3.4% AH after announcing chairman Kaleil Isaza Tuzman has resigned. Tuzman, subject of the documentary Startup.com and referred to as a "colorful character" in a November WSJ column, resigned as CEO in March.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • TIBX

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) -1.5% AH after announcing a $500M offering for convertible notes due 2032....

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) -1.5% AH after announcing a $500M offering for convertible notes due 2032. The software vendor intends to use $150M of the proceeds to repurchase shares, another $150M to pay down credit facility borrowings, and the remaining $200M for "general corporate purposes." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • GMXRQ

    GMX Resources (GMXR) +4.1% AH after estimating its Q1 production was 596K BOE, with natural gas...

    GMX Resources (GMXR) +4.1% AH after estimating its Q1 production was 596K BOE, with natural gas liquid production 35% above prior guidance. GMX is also guiding for Q2 production of 606K BOE, and 2012 production of 2.37M BOE, and says it hedged "a significant portion of our natural gas production in 2012 and 2013" at higher prices. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • STWD

    Starwood Property Trust (NYSE:STWD) -3.8% AH after announcing a 20M shares stock offering, good...

    Starwood Property Trust (NYSE:STWD) -3.8% AH after announcing a 20M shares stock offering, good for proceeds of $419M based on today's close. Starwood intends to use the proceeds to originate and purchase corporate loans, along with other assets. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • CPLA

    Capella Education (CPLA -1.4%) acquires the remaining interest in Sophia Learning, a social...

    Capella Education (CPLA -1.4%) acquires the remaining interest in Sophia Learning, a social teaching and learning platform. In January 2011, Capella became a majority investor in Sophia, which provides tens of thousands of free academic tutorials in math, science, English and and a number of other subjects.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3.6%) shares hit a 52-week low after Citigroup cuts its rating to...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3.6%) shares hit a 52-week low after Citigroup cuts its rating to Neutral from Buy and its price target to $22 from $28, citing near-term natural gas headwinds. The firm says the risk to filling such large funding gaps "in a downside scenario over the next two years is growing and by far greater for CHK than for any other company in our coverage group." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • PES

    Raymond James cuts its rating on Pioneer Drilling (PDC -3.3%) to Underperform from Outperform,...

    Raymond James cuts its rating on Pioneer Drilling (PDC -3.3%) to Underperform from Outperform, saying its stance on the U.S. rig count hurts its earnings and cash flow estimates for 2012 and 2013. The firm also downgrades a raft of other energy stocks, including Weatherford (WFT -3.6%) to Underperform from Strong Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • BRO

    Brown & Brown (BRO +1.8%) trades up ahead of Q1 earnings after the close. The company is...

    Brown & Brown (BRO +1.8%) trades up ahead of Q1 earnings after the close. The company is expected to post $0.33 per share on revenue of $297M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +3.3%) spike higher on high volume off of chatter that the firm...

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +3.3%) spike higher on high volume off of chatter that the firm plans to provide an update shortly. With short interest on DMND huge, all eyes will be all on what the scandal-tainted firm has to say.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • MSG

    Madison Square Garden (MSG -1.2%) looks like a buy to Rocco Pendola. Though he sees the company...

    Madison Square Garden (MSG -1.2%) looks like a buy to Rocco Pendola. Though he sees the company as a ripe target for a takeover, MSG is also an undervalued stock on its accord by his account due to its "multi-platform synergy" between sports, entertainment, and media properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC -3%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Deutsche Bank on narrowing WTI...

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC -3%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Deutsche Bank on narrowing WTI spreads and expectations that U.S. gasoline demand will be cut in half over the next 20 years. The firm also cut its price target to $45 from $50.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • ESL

    Defense/aerospace hardware vendor Esterline Technologies (ESL +2.7%) rallies on an upgrade to...

    Defense/aerospace hardware vendor Esterline Technologies (ESL +2.7%) rallies on an upgrade to Outperform from Credit Suisse. CS argues contract timing issues that have plagued Esterline will dissipate in 2H, and the company will get a lift from new contract opportunities related to aircraft programs, as well as margin improvement. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • MMSI

    Merit Medical Systems (MMSI +5.3%) is raised to Strong Buy from Outperform at Raymond James,...

    Merit Medical Systems (MMSI +5.3%) is raised to Strong Buy from Outperform at Raymond James, which cites a strong lineup of new products that should drive revenue growth above the industry average. With MMSI shares down 13% YTD, the firm believes sentiment is overly negative.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +1.2%) says it sold part of its Bucyrus distribution business in Peru to...

    Caterpillar (CAT +1.2%) says it sold part of its Bucyrus distribution business in Peru to Ferreyros in a transaction valued at approximately $75M. The move follows a chain of other divestitures by the company of Bucyrus assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • NCR

    NCR (NCR +2.9%) issues upside guidance for Q1, seeing non-GAAP EPS of $0.47 vs. $0.34 consensus...

    NCR (NCR +2.9%) issues upside guidance for Q1, seeing non-GAAP EPS of $0.47 vs. $0.34 consensus on revenues of $1.24B vs. $1.22B consensus, and raises 2012 EPS guidance to $2.40-$2.47 vs. prior $2.36-$2.43 and $2.42 consensus on $6.04B-$6.15B in revenues vs. $5.87B consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences (CSC +1.5%) moves up after Bernstein upgraded the shares to Market Perform,...

    Computer Sciences (CSC +1.5%) moves up after Bernstein upgraded the shares to Market Perform, saying they have a mixed view on shares overall, but the stock should benefit over the near-term on optimism in the appointment of its new CEO. Separately, the company says it's been awarded a new $113M contract by the U.S. Navy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • LLTC

    Linear Technology (LLTC +1.8%) moves up after being upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Nomura,...

    Linear Technology (LLTC +1.8%) moves up after being upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Nomura, saying it's a high quality name that should be a focus stock for defensive-minded investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • TTM

    Tata Motors (TTM +3.3%), India's largest auto maker by revenue, says its global sales jumped 26%...

    Tata Motors (TTM +3.3%), India's largest auto maker by revenue, says its global sales jumped 26% in March to 139,655 vehicles. Strong demand for Jaguar and Land Rover vehicles helped TTM post a 41% gain in global passenger car and SUV sales to 75,864 units.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • SCG

    Scana (SCG +0.7%) trades up despite a Goldman downgrade Sell on potential negative earnings...

    Scana (SCG +0.7%) trades up despite a Goldman downgrade Sell on potential negative earnings revisions and above average risk on its new nuclear project.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • WPRT

    Shares of Westport Innovations (WPRT -9.7%) fall off sharply on heavy volume as they hit levels...

    Shares of Westport Innovations (WPRT -9.7%) fall off sharply on heavy volume as they hit levels not seen since January. SA author RulingTheMarkets makes the long-term bull case for WPRT if the right entry point is found, finding the company poised to benefit from macro economic events unfolding in the natural gas market.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 6 Comments
  • AAPL

    There's no clear trigger behind the latest selloff in Apple (AAPL -3.4%); shares are now down 9%...

    There's no clear trigger behind the latest selloff in Apple (AAPL -3.4%); shares are now down 9% from their Tuesday high. Some speculate Texas Instruments' (NYSE:TXN) addition to the NASDAQ 100 (NASDAQ:QQQ) is playing a role, as index funds will need to sell some Apple to rebalance, but that can't explain why fellow large-cap index members Microsoft (MSFT +0.9%) and Intel (INTC +1%) are up. With Apple still up 43% YTD, perhaps a breather was inevitable.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 89 Comments
  • IMOS

    ChipMOS Technologies (IMOS -6.8%) dips after saying March revenues were $51M, down 3.4% year...

    ChipMOS Technologies (IMOS -6.8%) dips after saying March revenues were $51M, down 3.4% year over year, and for Q1 revenues were $148M, down 1.9% from the same period. Analysts were expecting average revenues of $152M for the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • UAL

    Shares of United Continental (UAL +4.1%) show strength in advance of the carrier's Q1 earnings...

    Shares of United Continental (UAL +4.1%) show strength in advance of the carrier's Q1 earnings report slated for release later today. Analyst Wolfe Trahan analyst Hunter Keay thinks UAL will see continued underperformance through the summer while a new reservation system is adapted by the company, but finds shares undervalued compared to peers when taking a longer view and factoring in its free cash flow potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • GCI

    Shares of Gannett (GCI -9.3%) sell off after the firm reported its Q1 results earlier. Though...

    Shares of Gannett (GCI -9.3%) sell off after the firm reported its Q1 results earlier. Though EPS beat estimates by $0.02 and revenue came in roughly in-line, the publisher's repeated warnings that its turnaround will take time and ongoing downward revenue spiral is spooking investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • MSG

    Madison Square Garden (MSG -1.5%) slips after Susquehanna downgraded the shares to Negative on...

    Madison Square Garden (MSG -1.5%) slips after Susquehanna downgraded the shares to Negative on valuation earler today. The firm raised its price target however, to $28 from $26.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • EF

    Wealth management firm Edelman Financial Group (EF +41.7%) is being taken private by affiliates...

    Wealth management firm Edelman Financial Group (EF +41.7%) is being taken private by affiliates of Lee Equity Partners for $8.85/share, or ~$257.5M, a 43% premium to its Friday closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ +7.2%) has given back a chunk of the premarket gains it saw on a report...

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ +7.2%) has given back a chunk of the premarket gains it saw on a report CNOOC (NYSE:CEO) is in talks to acquire the firm. Other Chinese solar names have given back most or all of their early gains: TSL -2.1%. YGE -2.9%. JASO +1.5%. HOKU +0.9%. Past remarks from the Chinese government have already led many to expect consolidation, and some fear a bit of M&A activity won't be enough to fix the solar industry's huge problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • AAP

    Advance Auto Parts (AAP -0.8%) trades lower after taking on a downgrade from BB&T to Hold from...

    Advance Auto Parts (AAP -0.8%) trades lower after taking on a downgrade from BB&T to Hold from Buy on a valuation call after shares have run up 28.5% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • PPG

    PPG Industries (PPG +0.9%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Citigroup, citing margin improvement...

    PPG Industries (PPG +0.9%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Citigroup, citing margin improvement from cheaper natural gas and the upturn in the automotive and aerospace sectors. The firm also raises its price target to $114 from $107.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • AMD

    AMD is one of the companies interested in acquiring MIPS Technologies (MIPS -2.7%), according to...

    AMD is one of the companies interested in acquiring MIPS Technologies (MIPS -2.7%), according to BSN, now that the #2 developer of CPU core designs (behind market colossus ARMH) is on the block. Buying MIPS would help AMD reduce its PC dependence, and also fit into its plans to develop chips featuring 3rd-party IP. However, BSN thinks CFO Thomas Seifert, the man said to "effectively run" AMD, could stand in the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • VNO

    Vornado Realty Trust (VNO +3.6%) shares jump as Chairman Steven Roth tells shareholders the...

    Vornado Realty Trust (VNO +3.6%) shares jump as Chairman Steven Roth tells shareholders the company will put “everything” on the table to raise performance, considering share buybacks or splitting into smaller firms that would focus on different types of properties. Keefe Bruyette upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -4.2%) falls on a downgrade to Hold from Morgan Stanley, which is worried...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -4.2%) falls on a downgrade to Hold from Morgan Stanley, which is worried about plunging natural gas prices. Though MS recently lowered its 2012 natural gas composite spot forecast to $2.40/MMBtu, the firm still thinks there's more downside than upside risk to its estimate. The same goes for its 2013 forecast of $3.85/MMBtu, given strong domestic production.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • RS

    Reliance Steel (RS +3.8%) gains after raising its Q1 earnings outlook on stronger-than-expected...

    Reliance Steel (RS +3.8%) gains after raising its Q1 earnings outlook on stronger-than-expected demand and pricing. The company anticipates earnings to be around $1.50 per share, up sharply from its earlier projection of $1.15 - $1.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • AVP

    Avon (AVP -1.6%) reiterates its rejection of a $10B buyout bid by Coty, WSJ reports, citing an...

    Avon (AVP -1.6%) reiterates its rejection of a $10B buyout bid by Coty, WSJ reports, citing an AVP spokesperson. Though Coty says it has set up more secure debt financing from JPMorgan Chase to back its $23.25/share proposal, the offer fails to "reflect the fundamental value of the company," the company reportedly says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • SPRD

    Chinese mobile baseband chipmaker Spreadtrum (SPRD -11.5%) is diving thanks to a Morgan Stanley...

    Chinese mobile baseband chipmaker Spreadtrum (SPRD -11.5%) is diving thanks to a Morgan Stanley downgrade to Equalweight. Spreadtrum, which is seeing growing competition from Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) and others, is expected to deliver its Q1 report on May 4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • SQNM

    Shares of Sequenom (SQNM +9.5%) pop after the firm raises its estimate for billings for...

    Shares of Sequenom (SQNM +9.5%) pop after the firm raises its estimate for billings for MaterniT21 in 2012 to 40K from a previous forecast of 25K. The firm says it will increase internal production goals based on the improved outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • INFY

    Infosys (INFY -2.4%) adds to Friday's losses from its dismal Q4 report, as Deutsche Bank...

    Infosys (INFY -2.4%) adds to Friday's losses from its dismal Q4 report, as Deutsche Bank downgrades shares to Hold from Buy based on "reduced confidence in near-term growth, given multi-client project ramp-downs" and "the focus on maintaining industry-leading margins limiting long-term growth opportunities." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • TRQ

    Shares of Ivanhoe Mines (IVN -5.8%) sink after Mongolia's government suspends certain mining...

    Shares of Ivanhoe Mines (IVN -5.8%) sink after Mongolia's government suspends certain mining licenses owned by SouthGobi Sands; IVN owns a controlling stake in SouthGobi Resources, which owns SouthGobi Sands. The move is believed to be related to the proposed sale of IVN's stake to Aluminum Corporation of China.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • RVBD

    Riverbed Technology (RVBD +4.1%) rallies after Cantor Fitzgerald predicts the WAN optimization...

    Riverbed Technology (RVBD +4.1%) rallies after Cantor Fitzgerald predicts the WAN optimization hardware leader will report "in-line to slightly better" March quarter results on Thursday. The firm adds checks indicate Riverbed, which was crushed in January due to weak guidance blamed on a product transition, can meet June quarter estimates, in spite of the Street's belief that forecasts need to come down. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • AMSC

    American Semiconductor (AMSC -3.6%) trades lower after filing a registration statement (S-1)...

    American Semiconductor (AMSC -3.6%) trades lower after filing a registration statement (S-1) with the SEC to sell up to 10.262M shares of its common stock on behalf of a shareholder.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • SSYS

    The 3D printing space heats up after a merger between Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS) and Object points...

    The 3D printing space heats up after a merger between Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS) and Object points to stronger growth in the sector. Forecaster Terry Wohlers sees $3.1B in industry-wide global sales by 2016 and $5.2B by 2020. SSYS +21.1%, DDD +11.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • SHPG

    ViroPharma (VPHM -4.4%) keeps selling off after losing its exclusivity with its Vancocin...

    ViroPharma (VPHM -4.4%) keeps selling off after losing its exclusivity with its Vancocin antiobiotic last week and seeing a FTC investigation against it get launched. Shares are down 29.9% over the last 5 trading session, a move that Jefferies calls an overreaction.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • SBUX

    Teavana (TEA +3.1%) agrees to acquire the assets of Teaopia, a mall-based specialty tea retailer...

    Teavana (TEA +3.1%) agrees to acquire the assets of Teaopia, a mall-based specialty tea retailer in Canada, for $26.9M in cash. Its impact to earnings is expected to be neutral in FY 2012, excluding transaction and integration expenses, and accretive by $0.03-$0.04 in FY 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (BSX -0.9%) will reportedly be awarded $40M from a Johnson & Johnson unit...

    Boston Scientific (BSX -0.9%) will reportedly be awarded $40M from a Johnson & Johnson unit emanating from a favorable ruling in a patent infringement case.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • C

    Citigroup (C +1.8%) shares rise in early trading after the bank posted Q1 results Nomura's Glenn...

    Citigroup (C +1.8%) shares rise in early trading after the bank posted Q1 results Nomura's Glenn Schorr calls a “well-rounded quarter" highlighted by continued loan and deposit growth as well as strong expense control. "We think Citi’s executing according to plan and the stock is cheap,” Schorr writes, adding he will revisit his estimates and $47 price target that go along with his Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 6 Comments
  • CIE

    Cobalt International Energy (CIE -7.5%) trades lower after a Financial Times article shines a...

    Cobalt International Energy (CIE -7.5%) trades lower after a Financial Times article shines a spotlight on possible violations of U.S. anti-corruption laws by its Angolan partner. Company response: PR.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • QQQ

    Even with the Dow up 100, tech is selling off this morning, QQQ -0.9%. Apple is off 3.2%, seeing...

    Even with the Dow up 100, tech is selling off this morning, QQQ -0.9%. Apple is off 3.2%, seeing a $580 handle for the first time in a month. Google is off 3.2%, its lowest price in a month as well. Other stalwarts: Priceline -2.2%, Chipotle -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • MAT

    Mattel (MAT -8.1%) says the completion of its $680M acquisition of HIT Entertainment, the...

    Mattel (MAT -8.1%) says the completion of its $680M acquisition of HIT Entertainment, the company behind children’s brands Barnie and Bob the Builder, cost $0.04/share in Q1 earnings as the toy maker's $0.02 EPS fell short of the $0.07 consensus. But the stock is taking a beating anyway, as is rival Hasbro (HAS -2.6%), which reports its results next week.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • SCHW

    Shares of Charles Schwab (SCHW -0.1%) gyrate after the firm reports a mixed bag with its Q1...

    Shares of Charles Schwab (SCHW -0.1%) gyrate after the firm reports a mixed bag with its Q1 earnings report. The online brokerage firm saw 240K new accounts open during the quarter, while profits for the period slipped 20% Y/Y on higher marketing and compensation costs. After shooting 2% higher on the open, shares sputtered a bit and are now in negative territory.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +1.6%) says it has lined up 8 financial institutions to create a...

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +1.6%) says it has lined up 8 financial institutions to create a $4B debt facility. The facility will be used to fund the construction of CEP's Sabine Pass LNG liquefaction plant, and its acquisition of the Creole Trail Pipeline from parent Cheniere Energy (LNG +3.5%). CEP recently received a $2B investment from Blackstone related to its Sabine Pass project. (PR) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR +3.2%) makes a 2% downward revision to its 2012 production estimate as...

    Denbury Resources (DNR +3.2%) makes a 2% downward revision to its 2012 production estimate as the result of asset sales in recent quarters, but the oil and gas company expects Q1 output is up 8% Q/Q when adjusted for the divestitures, with oil comprising the vast majority of the increase.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • PCO

    Pendrell (PCO -47.5%) shares are cut nearly in half at the open, after the California state...

    Pendrell (PCO -47.5%) shares are cut nearly in half at the open, after the California state appeals court overturned a ruling against Boeing that had awarded $604M to PCO, formerly ICO Global Communications Ltd., in a 2008 lawsuit.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • BAX

    Baxter International (NYSE:BAX) trades 3.8% lower premarket after it discloses along with...

    Baxter International (NYSE:BAX) trades 3.8% lower premarket after it discloses along with partner Halozyme Therapeutics that the FDA needs more long-term data on their jointly-developed HyQ product.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • HALO

    Shares of Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO) fall 23.1% premarket before tripping up circuit...

    Shares of Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO) fall 23.1% premarket before tripping up circuit breakers. All the fuss is over an announcement from the company that says the FDA requested more information on its HyQ Biologics Application before it can complete its review.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Market preview: European shares are rebounding from four consecutive weeks of losses and U.S....

    Market preview: European shares are rebounding from four consecutive weeks of losses and U.S. stock futures build on earlier gains following strong March retail sales. S&P Benchmark futures +0.6%. Spanish bond yields had spooked investors after surging past 6%, but they're now way down from earlier highs. Citigroup +1.9% following its earnings but Mattel -5.65%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • DRJ

    Dreams Inc. (NYSEMKT:DRJ) +30.6% premarket after the retailer agrees to be acquired for...

    Dreams Inc. (NYSEMKT:DRJ) +30.6% premarket after the retailer agrees to be acquired for $3.45/share, or ~$183M, by Fanatics Inc., an online seller of licensed sports products. The offer represents a 32% premium over DRJ's Friday closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • ECYT

    Premarket gainers: ECYT +114%. DRJ +30%. CSIQ +9%. SQNM +9%. LDK +7%. TSL +6%. RENN +4%. YGE...

    Premarket gainers: ECYT +114%. DRJ +30%. CSIQ +9%. SQNM +9%. LDK +7%. TSL +6%. RENN +4%. YGE +4%. STX +4%. JASO +4%. STP +4%. ANR +3%.
    Losers: PCO -47%. HALO -22%. SANG -5%. BAX -4%. MAT -4%. RBS -3%. VALE -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • STX

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) +3.9% premarket after enjoying a positive mention in the weekend...

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) +3.9% premarket after enjoying a positive mention in the weekend edition of Barron’s. An analysis of the disk drive maker suggests STX will benefit from a strong market position and a management that’s kindly disposed toward shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • DPZ

    Shares of Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) rack up a 2.2% gain premarket after Miller Tabak upgrades...

    Shares of Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) rack up a 2.2% gain premarket after Miller Tabak upgrades the company to a Buy rating from Hold on the strength of sustained comparable-store sales growth and improving margins. Analysts with the firm add $3 to their price target on DPZ to take it to $41.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • XSPA

    Mobile phone ringtone maker Vringo (VRNG) +22.7% premarket on news that billionaire investor...

    Mobile phone ringtone maker Vringo (VRNG) +22.7% premarket on news that billionaire investor Mark Cuban has taken a 7.4% stake in the company and is now its largest shareholder.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • SOL

    What's shaping up as a potential breakout day for Chinese solar stocks - Notable Calls says...

    What's shaping up as a potential breakout day for Chinese solar stocks - Notable Calls says maybe as high as 15%-20% - comes after the beat-up sector is viewed as attracting large-size suitors in China such as Sinopec, ChemChina, and CNOOC to help provide firms the financial backing to maintain operations during low demand periods.
